storyInfo: On the Stultifera, the Hunters are unable to reach an agreement with Alfonso, just as it is impossible for the cultists and townspeople of Gran Faro to reconcile with the Inquisition. Conflicts deeply-rooted, with a dire need for resolution.

attributes.content: Ah, you've returned.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Thank you for your contribution. I know how painful it must be for someone like you to go against your faith.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: But providence lies just ahead. This is by no means a false promise, but true redemption.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: I thank you.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Lord Carmen is far beyond our comprehension. There's no point trying to deceive him. He will discover the truth before long.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: You should also thank Thiago. Our lie has condemned him to death at the hands of the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: ...I have never seen the Herald of the Sea, but rumor has it, the Herald will not refuse the requests of its kin.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Because the choices of kin must surely benefit the entire kind, the thoughts of kin must also be shared by the entire kind. We ought to learn from this, as this is also a part of the Cycle.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Then we'll let Thiago worry about himself.
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: Ah, you still have doubts. They are unnecessary.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Our prophet, Miss Amaia. Will she really be able to come back?
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: She has simply chosen to return to the sea one step ahead of us. She is to locate our path, our Herald, and the trails of the sleeping city.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: If she returns, it is to help her kin. If she does not, it is because she is making preparations.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: We needn't worry too much about her. Just know that she wishes to avoid the scrutiny of the Inquisition, regardless of where she might be.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: ...Then this person, this Iberian. Why did we abduct him?
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: His patroness seems to have made some kind of agreement with Carmen. He is an enemy.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Haha... I really wish you'd choose another way of describing my relationship with the doctor.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You've been investigating us, have you not?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: I've devoted quite a lot of time explaining our ideals to you, and we would prefer not to hurt you. Have you thought things through?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: I think I've heard everything I need to know about your hypocrisy.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...Hypocrisy? Ah, you still speak of morality, the morality of the human realm.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: I couldn't care less what these Sea Terrors or Seaborn really are. All I see are a bunch of outlaws inventing a reason to vent their frustrations with Iberia and the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: While I haven't lived here for a particularly long time, I AM an Iberian.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: And I've been to a lot of places and seen a lot of different things. People like you who think they're special are actually a dime a dozen.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: If the gods you talk about are real, and, uh, all that nonsense about being the pinnacle of evolution or the bleeding edge of life—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: —Then surely those gods must look down on people like you, right?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: How dare you!
attributes.name: Calm Townsperson

attributes.content: ...No, he's right. That is why the Herald no longer speaks to us. That is why only Amaia can hear the voice of the ocean, and only she can guide us.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: (So there really was something off about Amaia. Tch, I should've caught on sooner.)
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: (That said...)
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: How's it looking?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Whatever those things of yours are, that nethersea brand, they aren't able to get into the center of town at all.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: That black monster can do more than fly, it can even belch out terrifying jets of flame. The nethersea brand can't spread faster than it's being burned.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: If this gets dragged out, then Gran Faro will fall into the Inquisition's hands as soon as the Sea Terrors holding back the Penal Battalion are exterminated.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Then we all die.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: No, Thiago, no.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: All these things you speak of... You do not grieve for the kin who willingly give themselves up to hold back our enemies.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: In other words, you are not yet resolved to sacrifice yourself for our entire kind at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Don't talk to me like that. Our interests happen to line up this time. I'm just an old fogey with no interest in becoming an ocean-hugger.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: ...What a lowborn, stubborn creature.
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Same to you, friend.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: And you, lad, didn't I warn you not to meddle in other peoples' affairs?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Thiago, you—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You know each other?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: No. He's just an outsider who kept hanging around the chapel. As the mayor, I need to have at least some idea of every person in town.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: You should've stayed out of it.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: Right then.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We should act soon, right? Or are we going to wait for the Inquisitor and his monster-wielding accomplice to burn my town to the ground?
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: We will not. You seem awfully attached to this city. Why?
attributes.name: Bizarre Cultist

attributes.content: Gran Faro is the embodiment of our generation-spanning vision to rebuild our country, heretic. Ask any of the Iberians who've joined you, and you'll understand.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: The Inquisition has taken enough from us, and I intend to pay them back double.
attributes.name: Thiago

attributes.content: I am Skadi, not Ishar'mla.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You pronounce it differently, but what does it mean?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Skadi knows, but dares not answer.
Gladiia told her that she is alright, and she is willing to believe her.
But that is only an escape. She knows what the name means.
It means a thunderous roar within the abyss. Flesh and bone rubbing against the rock walls until only the Will remains, surging beyond the ocean.
It means that after that harrowing battle, something was left in her body. 'Something.'
My blood and your blood are identical.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You smell my scent, exactly as we smell your scent.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You find us, kill us...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: When we do not understand, we kill you too.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: We feed the ocean. Our bodies have provided for the ocean.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ishar-mla, we possess the same home.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Inquisitor! How dare you join forces with them!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: W-What?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Get off my ship this instant! Otherwise you'll join them in my hunt, as the quarry!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Easy there, Mister Captain.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Now tell me, how did you... come to learn of this name?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I'll tell you exactly how. We ate the flesh of these things and our bodies began to change. I personally executed three of the survivors, until only we remained.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Now it's my turn to ask you—their blood also flows in your veins. I can smell it. And you must be more special than the others.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: What are you—
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Look at my hand.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Skadi looks down.
One of the captain's arms has taken on the form of a Seaborn, its newly-formed webbing clearly visible, and its tentacle-like extensions ever squirming.
He seems to be making an effort to restrain it. By the looks of it, whatever is inside that arm is also interfering with his body.
It thirsts for my mind. It tells me to liberate you, to talk to you, to listen to your thoughts.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Get off my ship before I kill the lot of you. Only by killing you can I maintain my sanity as a human—begone!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: —We've paid an immense price just to get here. If you truly still are that Iberian hero, then you should join us!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Think carefully, little Inquisitor.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I've been in a bitter struggle for my life on this ship for longer than my homeland has been at war. What could you possibly understand?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: A single year of confinement can break a person's will. Do you have any idea how many years we've spent here, flirting with the waves?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Seven or eight years ago, I personally executed the last crew member and threw him into the sea. He died as a human. He was the last to.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: We were Iberia's best sailors, warriors, and scientists, stalwart in our faith. The most common way to die aboard this ship... was suicide.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: You can't imagine what I've been through. The left side of my body snatched away even my dreams. I no longer needed sleep. That itself was a form of torture.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: And during this prolonged torture, I've had naught to do but hunt those monsters, large and small, and while away the remaining hours polishing my ship.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Leave me and my chief mate be, and return to where you came from.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: I don't belong to you, or to the sea. I belong only to my Iberia. To the Stultifera Navis.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Gladiia stops walking.
While she contemplates why this place is so clean, she notices a change in the scent.
Seaborn. Of course there are Seaborn here.
But, what is the cause of this impure odor? And where did this vague premonition she is starting to feel come from?
She can only continue walking, following the path etched in the back of her mind, and attempt to reach the depths of the ship.
Suddenly, she comes to a stop.
...Don't you think you're being a bit too obtuse, appearing on this primitive transport vessel that hasn't docked in over sixty years?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Bishop of the Deep.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You saw through me immediately. Do you suppose that means I chose the wrong place to appear?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You followed us here.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hardly. Strictly speaking, I was the one who arrived first.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: The ocean communicates with me. It accepts me. It aids me. From the very beginning, coming to this ship was a trivial task.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That you've been able to suppress your urge to rush forward and slay me is already quite impressive.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Is it because you feel this ship is vital to your grand plans?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: What are you after?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...You killed Quintus.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: I should've known better. So even you test-tube watching bottomfeeders—pardon my language—will pursue vengeance?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, you misunderstand.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Quintus was a bit too eager to attain results, and that temperament of his not only led to his demise, but also demonstrated conclusively that he was born human.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Not that that's something to be ashamed of. Under our doctrine, we will never become what we seek to be by thought alone.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: 'Only changes to nerve and sinew can be considered real.' Wouldn't you agree, Abyssal Hunter?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: We don't need to be enemies. I have no plans to do anything to you.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: One's end is decided at the moment of one's birth. Nothing can change this immutable fact.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You went through all the effort to follow us out to sea, just to spew this nonsense?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ah, about that...
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: That's not something you need to know.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Those lowly creatures won't be able to hold me back.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Amaia smiles sweetly but does not answer. A blue light emerges from under her feet, and it soon envelops the entire corridor.
The 'nethersea brand.'
...The nethersea brand at Gran Faro. So those traps were your handiwork.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hardly. You're all so quick to blame your every misfortune on the Church of the Deep, but never stop to consider the truth behind these phenomena.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: These children have always existed in Gran Faro. I simply... found them.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Hmph, cut the crap.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We're out in the middle of the ocean. Our touch, invisible to the naked eye, is everywhere. This ship may not be of much use in your quest to return to Ægir.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: But, must you really insist on returning? Have you never had the slightest inclination to... listen to what the Heralds have to say?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Seems you aren't too different from that stupid bishop after all. You've never even been in a real fight. Otherwise, you'd never say such an idiotic thing to a Hunter.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No. But not all Hunters take such pride in their arrogance.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: We will meet again, Gladiia. You've disappointed me, but that's fine. Perhaps it's for the better that you have something to break out of.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Meaning?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But whether you come or go, or whether Ægir comes and goes, is not for me to decide.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: You won't be leaving this conversation alive though?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Oh really?
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: (Earsplitting screech) —!!
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Quintus should've had a Herald by his side. You've fought with that Herald. You've spoken with that Herald.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: While you stagnate in place, the ocean is ever in motion.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Ægir is far from smart enough to curb evolution itself.
attributes.name: Amaia

attributes.content: Hold it!
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gla-dia...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Such weak, pitiful prey that cannot even speak. More like a beast.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hurry up and die. I still have a score to settle with that bishop. I need answers from her.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: —Did you hear that, Chief Mate? Our quarry brays. It calls out to us.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: The monster known as the chief mate nods slightly, and uses its claws to straighten the crown that's started to slip from its head.
It brays, it calls out to us— You brought yet more rabble with you?!
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: It must be Swordfish...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: She must've discovered something. There's something unusual about the smell here, the sea breeze is confusing us.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Good thing these filthy Ægir haven't scared it away. We've already been romping around for months, and I'd hate to see my ship even more beat up.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: By hunt... Do you mean you're hunting the Seaborn?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Seaborn? ... (Laughs huskily) Sure am.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: Hunting to live off the bounty of the land—hasn't humanity done so since the dawn of time?
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso

attributes.content: But if you still haven't left by the clock's next chime, you WILL die.
attributes.name: Captain Alfonso
